context: The Estonian word 'kõrge' is an adjective that primarily means tall or high, used to describe physical height of objects, buildings, people, and natural features. It can also be used metaphorically to describe elevated positions, status, quality, level, or pitch. The word has multiple grammatical forms including comparative (kõrgem) and superlative (kõige kõrgem/kõrgeim). In its singular form it's 'kõrge' and in plural form it becomes 'kõrged'. It's commonly used to describe buildings, mountains, trees, people's height, as well as abstract concepts like high prices, high quality, or high positions.
